meanings.definition: The act of trimming or cutting away the outer edges of something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully collected the parings of the apple before throwing them away.
meanings.sent2: The chef's precise parings of the vegetables showcased his skill.
meanings.sent3: The parings of the paper looked like confetti scattered on the floor.
meanings.sent4: With each paring of the wood, the sculpture began to take shape.
meanings.sent5: The parings of the fabric fluttered to the ground like delicate petals.

meanings.definition: Small pieces or portions that have been removed from a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: He saved the parings of cheese to sprinkle on top of the salad.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler used the tiny parings of gold to create intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The parings of the puzzle were scattered across the table, waiting to be assembled.
meanings.sent4: Her parings of the cake were so small, it seemed like she had barely eaten any.
meanings.sent5: The parings of the crayons were sorted by color in the art class.
